Returns: A @B_com#google#android#gms#games#snapshot#SnapshotContents_E@ object to use to write resolved snapshot data, or null if there was no conflict.
getResolutionSnapshotContents().Description: Retrieve the @B_com#google#android#gms#games#snapshot#SnapshotContents_E@ object used to update the data in case of a conflict. Pass this to @B_com#google#android#gms#games#snapshot#Snapshots#resolveConflict_E@ to resolve this conflict. Will return null if the status of this operation is not @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_E@.

Returns: The snapshot that was opened, if any. This will be null if the open operation did not succeed.
getSnapshot().Description: Retrieves the snapshot that was opened. This is always the device's most up-to-date view of the snapshot data. If @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Result#getStatus_E@ is @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_E@, the return value here represents the state of the snapshot on the server.

Returns: The modified snapshot data, or null if there was no conflict.
getConflictingSnapshot().Description: Retrieves the modified version of this snapshot in the case of a conflict. This version may differ from the values returned in @B_com#google#android#gms#games#snapshot#Snapshots#OpenSnapshotResult#getSnapshot_E@, and may need to be merged. Will return null if the status of this operation is not @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_E@.

Returns: The ID of the conflict to resolve, or null if there was no conflict.
getConflictId().Description: Retrieves the ID of the conflict to resolve, if any. Pass this to @B_com#google#android#gms#games#snapshot#Snapshots#resolveConflict_E@ when resolving the conflict. Will return null if the status of this operation is not @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_E@.

ClassDesc: Result delivered when a snapshot has been opened. Possible status codes include: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_OK_E@ if data was successfully loaded and is up-to-date. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_NOT_FOUND_E@ if the snapshot could not be found on the server. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CREATION_FAILED_E@ if an error occurred while creating the snapshot. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_E@ if a conflict was detected during the open operation. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONTENTS_UNAVAILABLE_E@ if the content for this snapshot could not be loaded. The metadata will still be valid for the returned snapshot, but it must be re-opened to be modified. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_FOLDER_UNAVAILABLE_E@ if the root snapshot folder for this game could not be found or created. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_MISSING_E@ if a conflict was being resolved and the ID was not found. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_NETWORK_ERROR_NO_DATA_E@ if the device was unable to retrieve any data from the network and has no data cached locally. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_CLIENT_RECONNECT_REQUIRED_E@ if the client needs to reconnect to the service to access this data. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_LICENSE_CHECK_FAILED_E@ if the game is not licensed to the user. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesStatusCodes#STATUS_INTERNAL_ERROR_E@ if an unexpected error occurred in the service.
